comments: BEST math prof on campus. This was my last attempt at Stats & I\'m so glad I ended up with him. No fuss with TI calculators, it is all Excel based! comments: Math 40!!! I\'ve never been one for math and Dr. Maiti was the best math instructor I could ever ask for! This class is an amazing setup. His lectures are so well planned and easy to follow. His Excel instructions and guidance is next to none. He makes sure EVERYONE is onboard before moving forward. Do the HW, pay attention, and you\'re good!!

comments: Great instructor with a unique teaching style. This class is Excel-heavy for statistics, so make sure that you have some basic knowledge on Excel use. The only reason you\'ll need the book is for reading problems or referring to data sets, so no MyMathLab! I highly recommend going to every class; he goes through examples very thoroughly. Ask Q\'s!

comments: 4 tests then final. Optional HW. He\'s the man, he wants to help and make sure you understand. Review before each test and allowed one cheat sheet(front&back). Got an A on every test by showing up and just paying attention and taking notes. Makes it super easy for people new to excel. Best stat professor.

comments: Great statistics teacher. Gives 4 tests and a final. Gives optional HW problems but does not check if completed. Has a slight accent but he explains everything so well and he teaches how to use excel for everything. Go to class and take good notes and you will pass with an A. You get to use notes and the book on every test.

comments: Stat and Prob. He uses Excel for everything. Do\'t worry if you\'re not skilled in excel, he goes through exactly what do to in class which is why it\'s a GREAT IDEA to attend. Like 5 tests and a cumulative final. You use Excel (and notes, previous tests, his own notes) on all of them so don\'t be scared. He has a slight accent.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (7)  Caring (5)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (5)  Clear grading criteria (4)  Respected (4)  Amazing lectures (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Tough Grader (1)
comments: He is the best statistics teacher out there! He does all of his lectures on excel, so excel is all you need to know. The tests are open book, open note, and you are allowed to use excel on them. Homework isn\'t mandatory. He\'s really helpful if you don\'t understand and makes excel formulas clear on notes so you can easily follow along his lectures.

comments: He does all his lectures on a piece of paper using the over head projector. I would have preferred if he used the white board, but no complaints other wise.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (7)  Caring (5)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (5)  Clear grading criteria (4)  Respected (4)  Amazing lectures (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Tough Grader (1)
comments: He assumes that you know your algebra, so if math isn\'t your strong suit, I would brush up on it a bit before taking business calculus. He goes fast but helps out and answers questions. He grades somewhat easy on exams. If a question is worth 5 points and you miss a step in the middle, you will get 2-3 points if you set it up correctly. good class.

comments: Great teacher; he teaches in a realistic manner. Very clear and has a sense of humor. Informative but not difficult. Open book and notes for all quizzes and final. He also drops your quiz with the lowest grade. Goes by fast so I suggest attending all class days. I recommend him for sure.
